required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of ESN364 in Healthy Japanese Male and Pre- and Post-menopausal Female Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Combined Single and Multiple Oral Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of ESN364 in Healthy Japanese Male and Pre- and Post-menopausal Female Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single and multiple oral doses of ESN364 in healthy Japanese male and pre- and post-menopausal female subjects. This study will also evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of ESN364 and its metabolite, and the pharmacodynamics (PD) of ESN364 after single and multiple oral doses administration in healthy Japanese male and pre- and post-menopausal female subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This study consists of two parts. Part 1; Single Dose (SD) and Part 2; Single and Multiple Dose (SD and MD).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by incidence of adverse events (AEs) in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: AEs will be coded using Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by incidence of AEs in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: AEs will be coded using MedDRA.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Body temperature in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Body temperature in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Blood pressure in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Blood pressure in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Pulse rate in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital signs: Pulse rate in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess vital signs as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Hematology in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Hematology in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Biochemistry in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Biochemistry in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Urinalysis in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: Urinalysis in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess laboratory values as a criterion of safety variables. Potentially clinically significant laboratory values will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by standard 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG) in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: Subjects should keep rest for 5 minutes before evaluation. Any clinically significant adverse changes on the ECG will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by standard ECG in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: Subjects should keep rest for 5 minutes before evaluation. Any clinically significant adverse changes on the ECG will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: Heart rate in Part 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: Heart rate in Part 2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in multiple dose (MD) of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: QT interval in Part 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: QT interval in Part 2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: RR interval in Part 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: RR interval in Part 2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: PR interval in Part 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: PR interval in Part 2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: QRS interval in Part 1

primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: QTc interval corrected by Fridericia method (QTcF) in Part 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by ECG parameters: QTcF in Part 2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD of Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess ECG parameters as a criterion of safety variables.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by body weight in Part 1
primary_outcome.description: To assess body weight as a criterion of safety variables

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by body weight in Part 2
primary_outcome.description: To assess body weight as a criterion of safety variables

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by menstrual cycle in pre-menopausal females
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to an average of two weeks after last dosing
primary_outcome.description: To assess menstrual cycle as a criterion of safety variables

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC) from the time of dosing to time 24 h (AUC24) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1 and after first dosing in Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: AUC from the time of dosing extrapolated to time infinity (AUCinf) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite4 in Part 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Percentage of AUCinf (AUCinf(%extrap)) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: AUC from the time of dosing to the last measurable concentration (AUClast) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Maximum concentration (Cmax) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1, after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Apparent total clearance after extra-vascular dosing (CL/F) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Time point prior to the time point corresponding to the first measurable (non-zero) concentration (tlag) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1, after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Time of the maximum concentration： (tmax) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1, after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Terminal elimination half-life (t1/2) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: volume of distribution during the terminal elimination phase after extra-vascular dosing (Vz/F) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 metabolite: Metabolite to parent ratio (MPR) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1, after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 metabolite in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: AUC from the time of dosing to the start of the next dosing interval (AUCtau) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Peak-trough ratio (PTR) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Accumulation ratio calculated using AUC (Rac(AUC)) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameter for ESN364 and its metabolite: Concentration immediately prior to dosing at multiple dosing (Ctrough) in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before dosing on Day 2, 3, 5, 7 and 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PK of ESN364 and its metabolite in Part 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic (PD) endpoint for ESN364: Luteinizing hormone (LH) level in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1, after first dosing in Part 2 and after dosing on Day 10 in MD part of Part 2
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the PD of ESN364 in Part 1 and Part 2.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hr after dosing in Part 1 and after first dosing in Part 2.

arm_group.description: Healthy male subjects will receive a single dose of ESN364.
Healthy male subjects will receive a single dose of ESN364.
Healthy male subjects will receive a single dose of Placebo.
Healthy male subjects will receive a single dose of ESN364 followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of ESN364 for 10 consecutive days at the same dose level.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pre-menopausal female ESN364 group in Part 2
arm_group.description: Healthy pre-menopausal female subjects will receive a single dose of ESN364 followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of ESN364 for 10 consecutive days at the same dose level.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Post-menopausal female ESN364 group in Part 2
arm_group.description: Healthy post-menopausal female subjects will receive a single dose of ESN364 followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of ESN364 for 10 consecutive days at the same dose level.
Healthy male subjects will receive a single dose of Placebo followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of Placebo for 10 consecutive days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pre-menopausal female placebo group in Part 2
arm_group.description: Healthy pre-menopausal female subjects will receive a single dose of Placebo followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of Placebo for 10 consecutive days.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Post-menopausal female placebo group in Part 2
arm_group.description: Healthy post-menopausal female subjects will receive a single dose of Placebo followed by washout period, then receive once daily dosing of Placebo for 10 consecutive days.

intervention.arm_group_label: Pre-menopausal female ESN364 group in Part 2
Post-menopausal female ESN364 group in Part 2
Post-menopausal female placebo group in Part 2
Pre-menopausal female placebo group in Part 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male subject between 20 to < 45 years of age, or female subject between 20 to < 65 years of age.
- Body weight at screening: ≥ 50.0 kg and < 80.0 kg for male, ≥ 40.0 kg and < 70.0 kg for female.
- Body mass index (BMI) at screening: range of ≥ 17.6 kg/m2 and < 26.4 kg/m2 [BMI = Body weight (kg) ÷ {Body height (m)2}].
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who participated or are scheduled to participate in any clinical trials or post-marketing studies within 84 days prior to screening.
- Subject has had previous exposure with ESN364.
- Subject has any clinically significant history of allergic conditions prior to study drug administration.
- Subject has any history or evidence of any clinically significant cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, endocrinologic, hematologic, hepatic, immunologic, metabolic, urologic, pulmonary, neurologic, dermatologic, psychiatric, renal, and/or other major disease or malignancy.
- Subject has contracted pyretic or symptomatic viral, bacterial, or fungal infection within 7 days prior to hospital admission.
- Any deviation from the normal range of blood pressure, pulse, body temperature, or routine 12-lead ECG at screening or on the day of hospital admission.
- Subjects who has any significantly abnormal results of laboratory tests at screening or on the day of hospital admission.
- Subjects who are positive for any of urinary drug abuse test or serology test at screening.
- Subject took a drug or underwent therapy within 2 weeks prior to hospital admission.
- Subjects used a drug or underwent therapy that affects sex hormones within 3 months prior to hospital admission.
- Subjects who had bilateral orchiectomy.
- Subject has used any inducer of metabolism in the 3 months prior to hospital admission.
- Subject has a history of smoking more than 10 cigarettes per day within 3 months prior to screening test.
- Subject consumes, on average, more than approximately 500 mg/day of caffeine
- Subject has a history of consuming more than 30 units of alcoholic beverages per week within 6 months prior to screening or has a history of alcoholism or drug/chemical/ substance abuse within past 2 years prior to screening.
- Subjects who conducted or is scheduled to conduct any blood donation or blood drawing.
